text.value: Lady Doctors, Lady Health Visitor (LHV), Community Mid Wives
No and have applied for in NADRA, I have token number
Yes but status not updated as widow
Yes but not present, at home
Not aware of the government facility
Protected (hand pump, Pipe water, protected well)
Unprotected (canal, river, open well, surface water, unprotected well)
Worried they will not be able to keep pardah
There is not enough assistance for returnees.
Security situation in the area of origin
Damage or lack of community infrastructure (Water, Electricity, Health, Education)
There are more economic opportunities here
Not shared with either humanitarian community or government
With the humanitarian community and government
No/ Less breast feeding milk(perhaps due to stress or poor health)
Shortage of adequate school infrastructure (furniture, study material, proper class room)
Children are involved by the school administration in activities other than related to education.
Psychological distress or change in behavior/ attitude
Women ate less food than men
None of the services were available
Visual Disabilities (blindness, color blindness, blurred vision)
Intellectual, developmental and learning disabilities(Attention-Deficit/ Hyperactivity Disorders, Asperger Syndrome, Autism, Down syndrome, Dyslexia)
Psycho-Social Disabilities (Anxiety Disorder, Bipolar Disorder, Depression)
Child himself/ herself donot consider it important.
Children are needed for domestic activities.
Children were denied admissions because they are IDPs.
Schools is not secure and at long distance.
Have no money for School fee, for books/ copies etc, for uniform.
Cultural Issues (No separate Schools for girls, Gender Discrimination).
Took children out of school for work
Adult ate less in order to make food available to children
Borrow food, or rely on help from friends
Sent family members to work abroad
No economic opportunities (due to conflict only)
Complicated process at registration site (eg. long queues)
Not able to reach the registration site (eg. money for transport, disabled, female headed hh)
Problem with CNIC (eg. dual address, duplicate family number)
I have been told NOT to register
Do not think it is important
Miss treatment because of IDPs status
Charge money for services (OPD services, hospitalization, medication etc)
Heavy amount charged in emergency/ critical situations
Liquid milk â€“ from an animal

How long people have to walk to collect the Water from the source?

Is the latrine availability inside house for females are sufficient for use (Dignity, privacy, access)?
How many individuals are accessing the Latrine facility inside your house?
Do you use soap for washing hands at critical times (before food preparation, after defecation, for mothers after cleaning babies)
Do you have appropriate water collection and water storage containers?
Sanitary napkins usage by females?
Who collects the water?
Have you used Govt health facility since the time of displacement?

select.label: If yes, have you or your family member received any of the following services at a government health facility?

If NO, please mention reason
